Specialty Health Network by Shoppers is looking to hire a Summer Co-op Business Development Student (May 4th to August 21st, 2026) within our Business Development department. Reporting directly to the Director of Business Development, you will assist with the creation of strategic healthcare partnerships between SHN and external partners. This role is highly cross-functional and requires collaboration with many internal teams and external partner organizations (primarily pharmaceutical manufacturers). This is an excellent opportunity for candidates interested in a career in business strategy, including fields such as management consulting, business development & partnerships, and corporate strategy. It is also a great opportunity to learn about commercial strategy roles in the pharmaceutical, medical device, digital health, and retail pharmacy industries. You will develop foundational skills that are critical for career growth, such as developing presentations for senior leaders, using frameworks to develop business strategy, managing financials and contract terms, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Our team prioritizes professional development. You will receive ample mentorship, coaching, and feedback to help you grow professionally. What You'll Do: Learn our business and industry: • Meet with internal teams to understand their business objectives, especially the Systems, Data, Clinical, and Program Management teams. • Meet with external pharmaceutical partners to learn about their needs. • Stay up to date on industry trends by reading relevant news articles and sharing those learnings with our team. Assisting with the business development process: • Maintain an up-to-date customer database, leveraging our Salesforce CRM platform. • Provide weekly updates to internal stakeholders regarding the status of partnership conversations. • Assisting with the maintenance of product pipeline trackers and contributing to the preparation of business development conversations. • Prepare PowerPoint and Excel documents that will be used to facilitate partnership conversations. • Assisting with project management tasks that are associated with responding to Request for Proposals (RFPs) and Request for Quotations (RFQs). • Contribute to partnership meetings-this can include presenting, taking notes, and following up on action items. Why work at Shoppers Drug Mart? Acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the Associate-Owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand. Benefit from a competitive pay program and online learning through Academy. Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community. How You'll Succeed: At Shoppers Drug Mart Inc., we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.
